Sentencas: HCN synthesis from methanol ammonia steam mixtures was studied with the cogeneration of electrical energy in a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC).
Titulo: Cogeneration of HCN in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The SOFC was electrolyte-supported using a gadolinia-doped ceria (CGO) electrolyte and operated in the temperature range 500-650 degrees C.
Titulo: Cogeneration of HCN in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The anode was a mixture of Ni/CGO composite and an iron antimony oxide catalyst, which is known to catalyze the ammoxidation of methanol to HCN.
Titulo: Cogeneration of HCN in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The catalytic activity of the anode, and its constituent materials, for ammoxidation and ammonolysis reactions was studied in microreactor experiments to optimize the composition of the anode.
Titulo: Cogeneration of HCN in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The anode off-gas from the SOFC was analyzed by gas chromatography as a function of operating temperature and the electrical power drawn from the cell.
Titulo: Cogeneration of HCN in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The anode off-gas contained HCN, with a maximum yield of 40% (with respect to methanol input) and selectivity for conversion of methanol to HCN of 47.5%.
Titulo: Cogeneration of HCN in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: CO(2), N(2), H(2), and CH(4) were the other significant reaction products.
Titulo: Cogeneration of HCN in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: There was no evidence for electrochemical ammoxidation taking place in the SOFC.
Titulo: Cogeneration of HCN in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: Rather, HCN was produced by ammonolysis of methanol, and the H(2) produced by side reactions was oxidized electrochemically in the SOFC.
Titulo: Cogeneration of HCN in a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell
